title: schema for values.yaml for KEDA http-add-on helm chart

additionalLabels.description:
Additional labels to be applied to installed resources.
 Note that not all resources will receive these labels.

crds.description: Whether to install the HTTPScaledObject CustomResourceDefinition

operator.description: Logging level for KEDA http-add-on operator.

kubeRbacProxy.description:
Logging level for KEDA http-add-on operator rbac proxy.
  allowed values: 
 - '0' for info
 - '4' for debug'n - or an integer value greater than 0

scaler.description: Logging level for KEDA http-add-on Scaler.

interceptor.description: Logging level for KEDA http-add-on Interceptor.

imagePullSecrets.description: The image pull secrets for the operator component

watchNamespace.description:
The namespace to watch for new 'HTTPScaledObject's.
Leave this blank (i.e. '') to tell the operator to watch all namespaces.

pullPolicy.description: The image pull policy for the operator component

port.description: The port for the operator main server to run on

replicas.description: Number of replicas of scaler deployment.

pullPolicy.description: The image pull policy for the scaler component

pendingRequestsInterceptor.description:
The number of 'target requests' that the external scaler
 will report to KEDA for the interceptor's scaling metrics.
See the KEDA external scaler documentation: 
 - https://keda.sh/docs/2.4/concepts/external-scalers/ for details on target requests

streamInterval.description: Interval in ms for communicating IsActive to KEDA

pullPolicy.description: The image pull policy for the interceptor component

admin.description:
configurable values for the interceptor's admin service.
 The admin service is a cluster-internal HTTP interface for triggering debugging behavior.

proxy.description:
configurable values for the interceptor's proxy service.
 The proxy service is the publicly accessible HTTP interface
 that production requests go to

min.description: The minimum number of interceptor replicas that should ever be running

max.description: The maximum number of interceptor replicas that should ever be running

waitTimeout.description: The maximum time the interceptor should wait for an HTTP request to reach a backend before it is considered a failure

tcpConnectTimeout.description: How long the interceptor waits to establish TCP connections with backends before failing a request.

keepAlive.description: The interceptor's connection keep alive timeout

responseHeaderTimeout.description:
ow long the interceptor will wait between forwarding a request to a backend
 and receiving response headers back before failing the request

endpointsCachePollingIntervalMS.description:
How often (in milliseconds) the interceptor does a full refresh of its endpoints cache.
The interceptor will also use Kubernetes events to stay up-to-date with the endpoints cache changes.
This duration is the maximum time it will take to see changes to the endpoints.

forceHTTP2.description: Whether or not the interceptor should force requests to use HTTP/2

maxIdleConns.description: The maximum number of idle connections allowed in the interceptor's in-memory connection pool. Set to 0 to indicate no limit

idleConnTimeout.description: The timeout after which any idle connection is closed and removed from the interceptor's in-memory connection pool.

tlsHandshakeTimeout.description: The maximum amount of time the interceptor will wait for a TLS handshake. Set to zero to indicate no timeout.

expectContinueTimeout.description:
Special handling for responses with 'Expect: 100-continue' response headers.
see https://pkg.go.dev/net/http#Transport under the 'ExpectContinueTimeout field for more details

tls.description: configuration of tls for the interceptor

enabled.description: Whether a TLS server should be started on the interceptor proxy

cert_path.description: Mount path of the certificate file to use with the interceptor proxy TLS server

key_path.description: Mount path of the certificate key file to use with the interceptor proxy TLS server

cert_secret.description: Name of the Kubernetes secret that contains the certificates to be used with the interceptor proxy TLS server

port.description: Port that the interceptor proxy TLS server should be started on

tag.description:
tag is the image tag to use for all images.
for example, if the operator image is 'myoperator' and
tag is 'mytag', the operator image used will bed
'myoperator:mytag'. 'latest' is used to indicate the latestd
stable release in the official images, 'canary' isd
the build for the latest commit to the 'main' branch,d
and you can target any other commit with 'sha-<GIT_SHA[0:7]>'d
-- Image tag for the http add on. This tag is applied to the images listed in 'images.operator',d
 'images.interceptor', and 'images.scaler'. d
Optional, given app version of Helm chart is used by default

operator.description: Image name for the operator image component

interceptor.description: Image name for the interceptor image component

scaler.description: Image name for the scaler image component

aggregateToDefaultRoles.description: Install aggregate roles for edit and view

LoggingLevelType.description:
allowed values are:
 -'debug',
 - 'info',
 - 'error',
 - or any integer greater than 0

limits.description:
The CPU/memory resource limit for the operator component.
Hard limit, anything above will be OOMKilled (for memory).

requests.description:
The CPU/memory resource request for the operator component.
 This value is used by k8s scheduler to select a node.
